rule_sets.heading: Chapter 1
rule_sets.subdivision: Live animals

rules.rule: All the animals of Chapter 1 are wholly obtained

rule_sets.heading: Chapter 2
rule_sets.subdivision: Meat and edible meat offal

rules.rule: Manufacture in which all the meat and edible meat offal in the products of this chapter is wholly obtained

rule_sets.heading: ex Chapter 3
rule_sets.subdivision:
Fish and crustaceans, molluscs and other aquatic
invertebrates,

rules.rule: All fish and crustaceans, molluscs and other aquatic invertebrates are wholly obtained

rule_sets.subdivision:
Fish fillets and other fish meat (whether or not
minced), fresh, chilled of frozen

rules.rule: Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapter 3 used are wholly obtained

rule_sets.subdivision:
Fish, dried, salted or in brine; smoked fish,
whether or not cooked before or during the smoking process; flours, meals and pellets of fish, fit for human consumption

rules.rule: Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapter 3 used are wholly obtained

rule_sets.heading: ex 0306
rule_sets.subdivision:
Crustaceans, whether in shell or not, dried,
salted or in brine; crustaceans, in shell, cooked by steaming or by boiling in
water, whether or not chilled, frozen, dried, salted or in brine; flours, meals and pellets of crustaceans, fit for human consumption

rules.rule: Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapter 3 used are wholly obtained

rule_sets.heading: ex 0307
rule_sets.subdivision:
Molluscs, whether in shell or not, dried, salted
or in brine; aquatic invertebrates other than crustaceans and molluscs, dried,
salted or in brine; flours, meals and pellets of crustaceans, fit for human
consumption

rules.rule: Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapter 3 used are wholly obtained

rule_sets.heading: Chapter 4

rules.rule:
Manufacture in which:

- all the materials of Chapter 4 used are wholly obtained; *and* - the weight of sugar used does not exceed 40% of the weight of the final product

rule_sets.heading: ex Chapter 5
rule_sets.subdivision:
Products of animal origin, not elsewhere
specified or included,

rules.rule: Manufacture from materials of any heading

rule_sets.heading: ex 051191
rule_sets.subdivision: Inedible fish eggs and roes

rules.rule: All the eggs and roes are wholly obtained

rule_sets.heading: Chapter 6
rule_sets.subdivision:
Live trees and other plants; bulbs, roots and the
like; cut flowers and ornamental foliage

rules.rule: Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapter 6 used are wholly obtained

rule_sets.heading: Chapter 7
rule_sets.subdivision: Edible vegetables and certain roots and tubers

rules.rule: Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapter 7 used are wholly obtained

rule_sets.heading: Chapter 8
rule_sets.subdivision:
Edible fruit and nuts; peel of citrus fruits or
melons

rules.rule:
Manufacture in which:

- all the fruit, nuts and peels of citrus fruits or melons of Chapter 8 used are wholly obtained, *and* - the weight of sugar used does not exceed 40% of the weight of the final product

rule_sets.subdivision: Coffee, tea, maté and spices

rules.rule: Manufacture from materials of any heading

rule_sets.heading: Chapter 10
rule_sets.subdivision: Cereals

rules.rule: Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapter 10 used are wholly obtained

rule_sets.subdivision:

inulin; wheat gluten

rules.rule: Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapters 10 and 11, headings 0701 and 2303, and sub-heading 071010 used are wholly obtained

rule_sets.subdivision:
Flour, meal and powder of the dried, shelled
leguminous vegetables of heading 0713

rules.rule: Drying and milling of leguminous vegetables of heading 0708

rule_sets.subdivision:
Oil seeds and oleaginous fruits; miscellaneous

rule_sets.subdivision: Olive oil and its fractions

rule_sets.heading: Chapter 16
rule_sets.subdivision:
Preparations of meat, of fish or of crustaceans,
molluscs or other aquatic invertebrates

rules.rule:
Manufacture:

- from materials of any heading, except meat and edible meat offal of Chapter 2 and materials of Chapter 16 obtained from meat and edible meat offal of Chapter 2, *and* - in which all the materials of Chapter 3 and materials of Chapter 16 obtained from fish and crustaceans, molluscs and other aquatic invertebrates of Chapter 3 used are wholly obtained

rule_sets.heading: ex Chapter 17
rule_sets.subdivision: Sugars and sugar confectionery

rules.rule: Manufacture from materials of any heading, except that of the product

rule_sets.subdivision:
Other sugars, including chemically pure lactose and glucose, in solid form; sugar syrups; artificial honey, whether or not mixed
with natural honey; caramel

rules.rule: Manufacture from materials of any heading, except that of the product, in which the weight of the materials of headings 1101 to 1108, 1701 and 1703 used does not exceed 30% of the weight of the final product

rule_sets.subdivision:
Sugar confectionery (including white chocolate),
not containing cocoa

rules.rule:
Manufacture from materials of any heading, except that of the product, in which:

- the individual weight of sugar and of the materials of Chapter 4 used does not exceed 40% of the weight of the final product, *and* - the total combined weight of sugar and the materials of Chapter 4 used does not exceed 60% of the weight of final product

rule_sets.heading: Chapter 18
rule_sets.subdivision: Cocoa and cocoa preparations

rules.rule:
Manufacture from materials of any heading, except that of the product, in which

- the individual weight of sugar and of the materials of Chapter 4 used does not exceed 40% of the weight of the final product, *and* - the total combined weight of sugar and the materials of Chapter 4 used does not exceed 60% of the weight of final product

rule_sets.heading: Chapter 19
rule_sets.subdivision:
Preparations of cereals, flour, starch or milk;
pastry cooks’ products

rules.rule:
Manufacture from materials of any heading, except that of the product, in which:

- the weight of the materials of Chapters 2, 3 and 16 used does not exceed 20% of the weight of the final product, *and* - the weight of the materials of headings 1006 and 1101 to 1108 used does not exceed 20% of the weight of the final product, *and* - the individual weight of sugar and of the materials of Chapter 4 used does not exceed 40% of the weight of the final product, *and* - the total combined weight of sugar and the materials of Chapter 4 used does not exceed 60% of the weight of final product

rule_sets.heading: ex Chapter 20
rule_sets.subdivision:
Preparations of vegetables, fruit, nuts or other
parts of plants

rules.rule: Manufacture from materials of any heading, except that of the product, in which the weight of sugar used does not exceed 40% of the weight of the final product

rule_sets.subdivision:
Tomatoes, mushrooms and truffles prepared or
preserved otherwise than by vinegar of acetic acid

rules.rule: Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapters 7 used are wholly obtained

rule_sets.subdivision:
Tomatoes, mushrooms and truffles prepared or
preserved otherwise than by vinegar of acetic acid

rules.rule: Manufacture in which all the materials of Chapters 7 used are wholly obtained

rule_sets.heading: Chapter 21
rule_sets.subdivision: Miscellaneous edible preparations

rules.rule:
Manufacture from materials of any heading, except that of the product, in which:

- the individual weight of sugar and of the materials of Chapter 4 used does not exceed 40% of the weight of the final product, *and* - the total combined weight of sugar and the materials of Chapter 4 used does not exceed 60% of the weight of final product

rule_sets.heading: Chapter 22
rule_sets.subdivision: Beverages, spirits and vinegar

rules.rule:
Manufacture from materials of any heading, except that of the product and headings 2207 and 2208, in which:

- all the materials of sub-headings 080610, 200961, 200969 used are wholly obtained, *and* - the individual weight of sugar and of the materials of Chapter 4 used does not exceed 40% of the weight of the final product, *and* - the total combined weight of sugar and the materials of Chapter 4 used does not exceed 60% of the weight of final product

rule_sets.subdivision:

rule_sets.heading: ex 2303
rule_sets.subdivision:
Residues of starch
manufacture

rules.rule: Manufacture from materials of any heading, except that of the product, in which the weight of the materials of Chapter 10 used does not exceed 20% of the weight of the final product

rule_sets.subdivision:
Preparations of a kind used in animal
feeding

rules.rule:
Manufacture from materials of any heading, except that of the product, in which:

- all the materials of Chapters 2 and 3 used are wholly obtained, *and* - the weight of materials of Chapter 10 and 11 and headings 2302 and 2303 used does not exceed 20% of the weight of the final product, *and* - the individual weight of sugar and of the materials of Chapter 4 used does not exceed 40% of the weight of the final product, *and* - the total combined weight of sugar and the materials of Chapter 4 used does not exceed 60% of the weight of final product

Unmanufactured tobacco; tobacco
refuse

in hermetically-sealed containers, and magnesium oxide, whether or not pure,

rules.rule: Operations of refining and / or one or more specific process(es)

Other operations in which all the materials used are classified within a heading other than that of the product. However, materials of the same heading as the product may be used, provided that their total value does not exceed 50% of the ex-works price of the product

rule_sets.heading: ex Chapter 41
rule_sets.subdivision: Raw hides and skins (other than furskins) and leather

rules.rule: Manufacture from materials of any heading, except that of the product

rule_sets.subdivision:
Raw hides and skins of bovine (including buffalo)
or equine animals (fresh, or salted, dried, limed, pickled or otherwise

not dehaired or split; raw skins of sheep or lambs (fresh, or salted, dried,
limed, pickled or otherwise preserved, but not tanned, parchment dressed or

salted, dried, limed, pickled or otherwise preserved, but not tanned, parchment

hair on, whether or not split, but not further prepared

Manufacture from materials of any heading, except that of the product

crusting

rule_sets.subdivision:
Silk yarn and yarn spun from silk
waste

rules.rule: Spinning of natural fibres or extrusion of man-made fibres accompanied by spinning or twisting

rule_sets.subdivision:
Woven fabrics of silk or of silk
waste:

rules.rule: Spinning of natural and / or man-made staple fibres or extrusion of man-made filament yarn or twisting, in each case accompanied by weaving
Weaving accompanied by dyeing
Yarn dyeing accompanied by weaving

Printing accompanied by at least two preparatory or finishing operations (such as scouring, bleaching, mercerising, heat setting, raising, calendering, shrink resistance processing, permanent finishing, decatising, impregnating, mending and burling), provided that the value of the unprinted fabric used does not exceed 47.5% of the ex-works price of the product

Yarn dyeing accompanied by weaving

Printing accompanied by at least two preparatory or finishing operations (such as scouring, bleaching, mercerising, heat setting, raising, calendering, shrink resistance processing, permanent finishing, decatising, impregnating, mending and burling), provided that the value of the unprinted fabric used does not exceed 47.5% of the ex-works price of the product

rule_sets.heading: Chapter 57
rule_sets.subdivision:
Carpets and other textile floor
coverings:

rules.rule: Spinning of natural and / or man-made staple fibres or extrusion of man-made filament yarn, in each case accompanied by weaving
Manufacture from coir yarn or sisal yarn or jute yarn
Flocking accompanied by dyeing or by printing

Tufting accompanied by dyeing or by printing

Extrusion of man-made fibres accompanied by non-woven techniques including needle punching

However:

- polypropylene filament of heading 5402

- polypropylene fibres of heading 5503 or 5506, *or*

- polypropylene filament tow of heading 5501

of which the denomination in all cases of a single filament or fibre is less than 9 decitex, may be used, provided that their total value does not exceed 40% of the ex-works price of the product

Jute fabric may be used as a backing

industrial use:- Polishing discs or rings other than
of felt of heading 5911

rules.rule: Weaving

rule_sets.subdivision:
- Woven fabrics, of a kind commonly
used in papermaking or other technical uses, felted or not, whether or not
impregnated or coated, tubular or endless with single or multiple warp and/or
weft, or flat woven with multiple warp and/or weft of heading
5911

rules.rule: Extrusion of man-made fibres or Spinning of natural and / or of man-made staple fibres, in each case accompanied by weaving

Weaving accompanied by dyeing or coating. Only the following fibres may be used:

- coir yarn

- yarn of polytetrafluoroethylene

- yarn, multiple, of polyamide, coated impregnated or covered with a phenolic resin

- yarn of synthetic textile fibres of aromatic polyamides, obtained by polycondensation of m-phenylenediamine and isophthalic acid

- monofil of polytetrafluoroethylene

- yarn of synthetic textile fibres of poly(p-phenylene terephthalamide)

- glass fibre yarn, coated with phenol resin and gimped with acrylic yarn

- copolyester monofilaments of a polyester and a resin of terephthalic acid and 1,4-cyclohexanediethanol and isophthalic acid

Dyeing of yarn of natural fibres accompanied by knitting

rules.rule: Each item in the set must satisfy the rule which would apply to it if it were not included in the set. However, non-originating articles may be incorporated, provided that their total value does not exceed 15% of the ex-works price of the set
